Brave is a result of this marriage.
Unfortunately some beautiful images didn't fool me.
Lack of everything and no substance.

My wish upon a star: I hope BRAVE will push Pixar and Disney to divorce...

I'll admit 'Brave' doesn't have quite the wall to wall boldness, rule-breaking and sheer brilliance of the very best
of Pixar's work, but I'll still take it over 95% of the Hollywood films I've seen this year. It never bored me, it made
me smile a lot, laugh a little, and was a more touching look at the complexity of mother and daughter
relationships than most 'grown-up' films that try to deal with the subject.

It also has a heroine who is a spunky, tough and first rate advocate for girl power, while still being heart-meltingly vulnerable
at just the right moments.

It has tremendously talented voice actors in Billy Connolly, Kelly Maccdonald, and especially Emma Thompson.

Most important, it has a twist half-way through that takes it in a delightfully unexpected direction. I will admit, for the first
half I was a bit under-whelmed, The film seemed more Disney than Pixar,with 'safe' humor and ideas. Just a touch disappointingly predictable.
But then a witch gets involved in this medieval Scottish tale, and with a twist that's more Shakespearian comedy than Disney, suddenly this is
a new film we haven't seen before. The second half easily won me back over, and I was left feeling, as I always seem to be, that working
for Pixar must be just about the greatest job in movies.
Was a funny family friendly piece. Would happily watch over with the kids. Loved how adolescence was displayed with out going overboard.
Loved this movie! The story is so wonderful and the background is so detailed. It held the attention of all my Grandchildren aged between 2-9. We will watch this movie many times.
Delightful film for all ages; it's funny, there's mystery, an adventure from start to finish. So glad thus is now a DVD,

The graphics was very realistic.  Wonder what they use to create it.
The storyline is weak, in my opinion.  Nothing compelling to keep me interested.
Some part was ridiculous but I cannot tell because I do not want to ruin it for other people.
The most entertaining part is the tripplets.  Overall it's worth the $4.99 for the family and kids.

Let's get one thing straight.  I am an avid Disney Movie/Pixar mother.  I earned over 6,000 disney movie rewards over the past 18 months.  As soon as my daughter was born, I started to build my collection.  I have my collection in VHS, but wanted Blu-Ray.  Blu-Ray is awesome.  Now, let's get to this review...

  The accent on the main character is really bad.  There is no consistency with her accent, which really takes away from the story of the movie.  Not that the story is that great.  Spoiler...  A young princess runs away, meets a witch, her mother turns into a bear, and she has to learn that she loves her mother even when her mother is cross, and all that jazz.  Her mother becomes normal again, but let's face it, this movie isn't normal, IT IS WEIRD!!

  I have never been great at reviewing movies, but I bought this one and regret having done so... My daughter has made me take it out of the player 3 times in the past week because she just isn't interested.  Her movie of choice over this one?  Tangled of course.

  If you can get this movie really cheap and used, do it... New?  Not worth your time or money.

Loved this movie! Always loved entertainment that showcased girl power! Also a good movie for families, especially mothers and daughters, to show each other's perspective, how that can harm relationships, but yet show that each can learn from the other, and see each other in their light, not in stereotypes.
Heartwarming movie for the whole family! Some parts may be scary for small children but all in all..Great job Disney!!

The plot moved along much more quickly and with less interest than other Pixar movies.  Enjoyed watching it, but it's not up to the story telling standard of the others. Also disliked the low class humor.
The animation was excellent.  The story was good. It was humourous, and had unexcpected turns.  Heroine was someone easy to relate to.
Good movie for girls and moms to watch together. It was cute but not my favorite Disney movie. I think my kids felt the same way.

I am sure the product is fine, but I waited online for more than 3 hours to try and buy Brave at the discounted rate. I wouldn't have bothered had Amazon not informed me that I had a "good chance" of getting a copy when I was originally waitlisted. I was able to see the percent of other deals that were being bought, but unable on the only one I was supposedly on the waitlist for with a "good" chance of getting. I waited there in good faith for 3 hours like an idiot but my "good" chance never came through and the deal just expired. PERHAPS AMAZON SHOULD CONSIDERING UPDATING YOUR CHANCE AT GETTING AN ITEM AS OTHERS ARE GRADUALLY SOLD, THUS CHANGING THE ODDS. I don't enjoy wasting 3 hours under false pretenses.

This movie was great (and I'm a full grown adult). It was full of action and it was hilarious. I like movies like this, where women are not waiting for their prince to save them-she was a strong and independent girl. Great for the family!

Such a cute movie. My son wanted to watch it over and over. I watched it again without him. But I always love disney movies. Great story for mothers and daughters too. My 3 year old son even got the story about the bond with your mother.

I am a Disney Geek - so it was almost certain I'd like this movie. But because it wasn't highly rated when it came out, my expectations were a little low. So it was a very pleasant suprise when the movie was so wonderful!

The princess is this movie is not the standard Disney princess - and more realistic for that. It was a wonderful way to escape reality for just a little while!

We purchased this movie sight unseen because it was Pixar. We expected it to be as excellent as their other animated films (Cars - the first one, Toy Story, Up, etc). It isn't. I'm not really sure why it got such high ratings.

Yes, the main character is fun, she's strong, she's witty, she has a mind of her own. Still, the overall storyline is weak in many ways. And really, although it was presented differently in this film, a family member turning into a bear has been done (remember Brother Bear?).

The voice actors were well chosen, the animation itself is absolutely beautiful, but we certainly wish we had rented this before purchasing. Next time we'll know better.

I agree with those who say that Pixar isn't what it was prior to the Disney merge, but really, did anyone expect it to be? I know I didn't. It's really too bad. Pixar had a great thing going. They were 'old style' Disney, something I think Walt would have been proud of. Maybe the next attempt will be better.

Would I recommend Brave? Sure, it's good enough entertainment, but I do suggest renting, not buying.
We watched Brave with our 2 and 3 year old sons and they loved the movie. They were frightened at one point in the movie, but overall they enjoyed the movie.
Loved the film.  It was amazing.  Love the plot line.  Complete Mother/daughter film.  First film in a long time that addresses the issues that mothers and daughters have.
A fun movie to watch with the family or by yourself, Pixar always puts out quality movies. I thoroughly enjoyed this film.

I am so disappointed with the movie BRAVE. Pixar is not the same after Disney took it over. I thought this was going to be an empowering movie for young girls to see, but it fell super short. Loved the graphics, her dress, hair and that she is a tough girl, but that doesn't mean that she should go on an impulse, that she can't think things through. All I saw was be free, do what makes you feel happy and even after you destroy your family with grief, things will be the way you always intended it to be. BLAH...I think I'm waiting a long long time before I show this to my 3 year old. I don't expect to be able to protect them forever, but I do find that relativism is harder to deal with than any other thing in this world. Do what makes you happy and you can't go wrong!!! BIG NO NO. Do what God would want you to do, even if it's something you don't want to do, bc in the end God knows what is best. I was disappointed in the whole plot. Instead of forcing someone to marry someone (which is true historically, but not really applicable in this age), it could have been a story line like that of the Little Mermaid III, where at first she doesn't understand why her mom would make her do certain things, but then it turns out how mom was right all along. Not go on an impulse without thinking things through (like Tangled, where Rupunzel DID think things through). The 4th king (refering to shakespeare's macbeth) had consequences, but as a girl, everything I (or any girl) will do, will in the end turn out okay no matter what. I'm sorry...I don't mean to be so uptight about this issue, it's just a hard reality check that there are less and less quality movies being made these days.

Whenever we stream Amazon movies from our LG smart tv we have problems with the volume not being loud enough...we don't have this problem when we stream Amazon movies from a Roku onto other tv's. Not sure why this happens so we just hooked up Bose speakers and still enjoyed the movie. I'm sure someone out there knows the solution to this problem..? Quality of picture was good.

What's not to like?  This is a fantastic movie with a VERY strong princess--she doesn't need a Prince Charming at all, and she has both her mother AND her father in her life.  Beautiful story, beautiful graphics, lots of fun!

"Pixar has done it again and brought somewhat of a revival to a slightly fading record of films like Toy Story 3 and Cars 2. Well, in the end, they thought the story of a rebellious young princess would be the framework of a Disney film but hasn't with its unique elements of neat and high-level graphics, not needy of a man scenario, and the historical component respectable to 12th-century Scotland. Like many Pixars, this one will always be in the conscience of someone who wants to work there. Don't fear the critics but bear in the mind that this isn't Toy Story or Monsters, Inc.-level of greatness. If you like Mulan or Princess Mononoke, you'll love Brave."

P.S. In some way or form, the film might be more interesting if having a Scottish Gaelic/Alba language track. Only enhances the experience and Pixar, from some's standpoint, wouldn't mind enhancing authenticity hopefully.

I am a fan of Pixar movies.  All of them have been anywhere from very good to masterpiece level...until Brave.  This movie can only be described as despicable.  It is rated PG, but it might as well be PG-13, as it should not be shown to any children under 12 (or actually no one under the age of 30 should see this movie).  The only good part about this movie is the beautiful cinematography, but otherwise its trash:

1. The movie simply advocates for a radical sort of rebellion by a teenage girl.  Yes, supposedly she is sorry and remorseful, but if that is so then why does everything go her way at the end anyway, and she changes her mother like she wanted to in the first place.  Come on teenage girls, rebel against your mother as best you can, then cry when you nearly destroy your family and then your family will do what you wanted them to do in the first place.  This movie is a recipe for disaster in any family.

2. The is a dream movie for ultra-feminists.  Not the true feminists who want equality and opportunity for women, but the ones who feel the presence of males is superfluous, and women can do everything themselves without any males being present.  They do everything right while the men and boys are no better than a bunch of monkeys (sorry if I insult any monkeys for comparing them with the male characters in this cartoon).

3. The violence of this movie is way beyond anything children should see.  I guess with kids these days exposed to violent video games and movies without parental supervision, this movie may be not a shocker, but for any normal kid living a normal kid's life, this will simply bring your boy or girl nightmares.

4. The theme of this movie is:  get rid of any traditions and set your own path.  Freedom, finding your own love, no input from mother or family, that's the way a girl should act.  Then if you end up in poverty with 3 kids from 3 different boyfriends, that's alright, you made your own decisions, or paraphrasing the cartoon, you have set your own fate (and set the fate of your family towards certain disaster).

5. This is the closest a cartoon has ever gotten to being a form of child abuse.  It can only confuse good kids and make not-so good kids believe that their overbearing mother and stupid father are the cause of all their problems.  The supposedly redeaming quality of the ending again would only make sense if the girl would actually make the right decision in the end and listen to what her parents asked her to do.  But essentially nowhere in the movie does the daughter listen to her parent's commands, from beginning to end.

6.  Some have commented on the crass humor and inappropriate images, but these are the least of the problems of this movie.  The violence and the radical propaganda are what make this movie a piece of garbage.

Shame on you Pixar, you have completely lost your senses and the respect of this former fan of yours.
This was a wonderful story with a great moral!  You will watch it over and over again.  A must see for mothers with stubborn daughters!!
Watched it over and over again on my Amazon Video rental that I bought the DVD. How's that for Brave?!
This was anoth great Disney movie. My kids love it. No matter how old you are or what gender, it has something for everyone..

I appreciate the movie's very strong female point of view to the story. The heroine, Merida, is the main character. There is no handsome prince. The movie is mostly about the relationship of two strong women, Merida and her mother. This is an important story. It is important that it sets strong role models for young girls and it expands the pantheon of Disney princesses.

Merida is a master at riding her horse Angus and is an extremely skilled archer. As with many teenage women Merida is at odds with her traditionally minded mother. In the scene when Merida declares, "I am Merida. Firstborn descendant of Clan DunBroch. And I'll be shooting for my own hand!" My red-headed, freckled five year old granddaughter squealed with delight and has been repeating the line with a Scottish accent ever since. This is a movie with a little bit of battle scene violence but the story is well worth it.

Disney provides a great movie, wonderful in its entertainment value and has a lesson to teach everyone. It was a whole range of emotions and more. Definitely a great mother-daughter movie as well, with plenty of comedy in it and never a dull moment!

Brave is a spectacular movie. The animation is perfect, the colors are so bright and rich, and the detail is top notch.

The 3D is wonderful, though there are not alot of pop outs, the depth is fantastic. It really helps to show the vastness of the movie. Even while watching in 3D this movie doesn't lose alot of color, which is a big plus. My only complaint with the 3D is that is doesn't full up the whole screen, you get the black bars on top and bottom, and I think that kind of hurts a 3D movie, but that's just my opinion.

The story itself was really great. It was nice to see such a strong willed female lead. I have read a few negative reviews about nudity, but there is no need to worry, it was just a few bare butts and nothing else, hell you see worse on TV.

I say buy this one, especially if you have younger children, I have five kids, 2 boys and 3 girls, with the oldest being 8, and they all loved this movie, as did my wife and I. Hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

Kiddos and I enjoyed this movie. Had some scary parts for my six year old but we all liked it. Even my 16 yr old watched with us.
a truly wonderful animated movie . . . the animation was superb, the story was engaging and the message was universal for all. voices were also top shelf
The kids and I really enjoyed this movie. I will  be buying the DVD. My husband even enjoyed it. Thanks.
The grandkids loved it. They watched every minute of it.  Even adults enjoyed it.  The color the story were all above expectations.
Streamed perfectly from my playstation 3 and highly enjoyable as expected from a Disney movie. I highly recommend  it to all ages.

Cute movie, but wasn't about what I thought from the previews.  It is a great family friendly movie with quality animation.
The story was entertaining, the voice acting and dialect were excellent, and the visuals were stunning (hair and fabric especially).

A girl with wild hair, being adventurous, defying custom and owning a bow; what's not to like about this story, right?  Well, that's what I thought going in.  I had heard quite a bit about this movie and decided I should probably watch it.  It was ok, but it certainly didn't make me use up that whole box of tissues like most Pixar movies do (the first five minutes of UP anyone?).

Merida is a young princess growing up in the woodlands of Scotland.  Her mother tries to teach her to be the perfect lady, but Merida would rather be out with her horse Angus, shooting arrows at targets and having adventures in the woods.  When it comes time for three suitors to compete for her hand, Merida decides she'll have none of it and comes in contact with a witch who promises to help her change her mother so she won't have to go through with the marriage.  The problem is, it changes her mom a little too much, and into something that her dad is not very fond of.  And only Merida can fix the problem.

Ok, this might be a spoiler of sorts, but I kind of think Merida is a bit of a sociopath.  Take the potion, her mother is doubled over in pain and instead of thinking that maybe she poisoned her and she should get help, Merida is more concerned on if her mother's changed her mind about the marriage.  Then later on she watches her mother eat a few berries and then only tells her about the fact that they are poison and giggles while she sputters them out.  To me that is just a bit crazy.  Sure Merida has some good aspects, she's disciplined in her practice of the bow and arrow, will try to save her mom, and gets along well with her brothers.  But my goodness she can be quite scary as well.  Her mother I thought was very sweet in contrast.  Sure she doesn't want to listen to Merida's wishes, but really for that time in history she was doing what she was supposed to.  And Merida's dad was just comic relief sadly and not a figure you could learn from in this story; her brothers were the same type of characters.  I just couldn't really feel connected to any of the characters though.

Voice Cast:
Kelly Macdonald: Merida
Emma Thompson: Queen Elinor
Billy Connolly: King Fergus
Julie Walters: Witch
Robbie Coltrane: Lord Dingwall
Kevin McKidd: Lord MacGuffin and son
Craig Ferguson: Lord Macintosh

I think all of the voice cast did a good job.  The Scottish accent was certainly there and Macdonald had enough spunk for Merida.  Thompson as Elinor was calming although she could raise her voice if need be.  All the guys were the bumbling sort that the movie cast them as.

The plot certainly wasn't what I expected it to be.  From the previews I thought Merida would be going on adventures and saving her country or something.  That was not the case.  She was just saving her mother from a mess that she had made and learning a little life lesson about not trying to change your own fate for selfish reason.  The problem is that the storyline was a bit convoluted and since this is a kid's movie, I'm not sure that younger or more immature kids could actually get any sort of lesson out of the movie.  There were some tender moments between Merida and her mom, and those were nicely done, but they were still offset by the times that Merida was a bit socio-pathic.  And quite frankly, the pace was so fast that it was a whirlwind trying to make anything of the life lessons the movie was teaching at times.  I wanted to like it, I really did, but while being a cute story about a mother-daughter relationship, it didn't use Merida to her full potential or keep my interest.  It should also be noted, that since this is a kid's movie, that there is some violence, especially towards a very scary bear.  It could be frightening for some.

What was good was the animation.  I always like Pixar and its films and this was no different.  Fantastic use of color, especially in Merida's hair, and even without watching it in 3D it was still wonderfully involving.  I especially liked the way they portrayed the Willow the Wisps.  The music too was very nice and I liked the Scottish theme it had.  They even had Bagpipes.  And "Touch the Sky" had that right element of adventure and bravery to its lyrics.

An ok movie, it had the wonder of Pixar's animation and great music, but just a lackluster plot and characters that would merely rate average.  It won't stop me from watching Pixar, but I may have to go re-watch Up to regain my love of Pixar.

This movie is visually spectacular. If you know anything about what it takes to computer generate hair and fur you will appreciate this artistic effort even more. I spent a lot of time watching Merida's curls.

As for the story, It's about the age old struggle regarding family values, tradition, self fulfillment and the willingness to see the world through another's eyes. It's a coming of age story for not only the teenage protagonist Merida, but for all the people around her.

In a way Disney is showing us how they are learning this lesson. They have been of the old belief that there must be a one-dimensional villain. Their latest collaborations with Pixar has prodded them to change this. Yes, there is a peripheral "big bad monster" but he is on the edges of the story and not a direct driver of the story.

In this movie the village is obsessed with the fear and loathing of bears. Because of peculiar circumstance they learn that maybe bears aren't so bad after all. That's not the main story line but it is a lesson to think about.

I love this movie.  Fantasy, happy endings, comedy, and a lesson.  Good for young girls just exhibiting rebellion.  I'm 55 years old, but the kid in me is alive and well.  I tend to be nonobjective when it comes to Disney and Pixar animations.  I don't think I have seen two or three I didn't like.  It brings back the wonder and excitement of a full, wonderful life ahead, where it's possible to achieve most anything, and be the master of your fate.

Kids/adults will enjoy this movie!  I enjoyed the story and it was definitely full of adventure...Go Brave Go....her brothers are HILARIOUS!

Being a digital artist myself, seeing epic or moving animated movies that are extremely well thought out, animated, and put together is part of what inspires me and keeps me going.  This wasn't really one of those movies but it's enjoyable.

The plot line, which is no doubt what most people watch for, is mildly entertaining and predictable to a point.  It has several noticeable incongruities and odd 'turns' that make little sense but pretty much have to be there for the movie to get on with the plot.  A lot of it has to do with developing the characters, especially Merida's mother.  She suddenly has, to me, a mostly inexplicable change off heart.  The rest of the characters stay static; except for Merida... somewhat.  I don't get the feeling that she's genuinely changed but doing things to save her mother.

Compared to other extraordinary Pixar and animated films in recent times, there is nothing about this movie's rendering and appearance that is superb.  Everything is standard fair.  The only aesthetic palette teaser is Merida's hair.  There's no breaking the mold with 3D here.

That said... it's -okay-.  I'd watch it again for entertainment purposes and mothers/daughters alike can take a lesson from the power struggle.

As usual, I read the one star reviews before I actually saw this movie, and I have to say - there are some serious spazzes out there.  People were talking about how dark and horrifying this movie was, with small children running screaming from the theater and protective mothers preparing to make a dash, which, frankly, gave me even more motivation to watch the film.  I have to wonder what pile of powder puffs these people have been living under, because this movie was hardly the dark, gory nightmare they made it out to be.  I mean seriously, what kind of lies has a parent been telling a child for them to be crying over a bear eating fish? Come on people!  The reviews I read had me thinking I was going to see something entirely different from what really happened.

There's a maid whose cleavage is rather prominent (not spilling out of her clothes, but the cleavage of a full figured woman in clothing that a woman of her station would have worn during that time period), but it's suited to her figure - frankly, big girls have big breasts, and big breasts make for noticeable cleavage.  I didn't find it offensive, but accurate. Kids see more on regular tv, the internet, [home] and magazines than what was shown in this movie.  The only other thing that some may have found offensive were the bare bottoms of the clansmen when they had to use their kilts to get off the roof after the triplets locked them up there. And there was the ridiculous fighting between clans due to the delay in a decision on the suitors, but there's a greater message lost on those who get caught up in the superficial.

The mother/daughter rift and emotions were real.  Elinor's doing her best to prepare her daughter for what seems to be inevitable [according to tradition], Merida isn't ready and thinks it's all unfair (especially given they just dropped the bomb on her, no warning this was about to happen at all) - most of us would feel the same way about being forced by tradition to do something you neither want or are ready to face, never mind the fact that the sons she had to chose from were seriously lacking in so many ways and downright unappealing.  Elinor is the calm in the storm.  She's smart, composed, and commands respect just by her presence - and she's trying her hardest to teach her daughter the importance of these traits in their environment, but Merida is daddy's unruly girl and bucks at the constraint of her mother's constant chiding, correcting and teaching - she just wants to be herself.  All of it is understandable and real.  They both learn something about themselves via the spell and gain a new respect for each others differences - daughter applies a lot of mother's long-taught lessons (kids are listening even when you think they aren't) and mother finds a strength and freedom she didn't know she had.

Some people ask, "why a bear?"  Why not a bear? Would a talking frog have gotten the point across about the strength of a mother's love and protection? No.  The humor wasn't quite on par with what we're accustomed to, I'd agree that it's more slapstick than wit, and there is something lacking between the realization that the old woman's a witch and the decision to ask her to change Elinor (happened too fast, no questions or thought, just a knee-jerk decision (which some people do in real life) - but there is a lesson to be learned from that too).  It's a bit disappointing that Merida didn't get to use her archery skills in a more heroic way, but maybe that's the reality of her existence and part of what will eventually make her a good queen.  The triplets and the maid were fun.  The men were reduced practically to oafs, in that boys-will-be-boys sort of way (embellish the truth, fight now ask questions later), which was rather disappointing considering they were leaders, but at the same time it's refreshing not to see the usual perfect, buttoned-up royals that Disney tends to portray.  Given the men's, behavior though, there's no wonder Elinor is always so restrained and worried about her daughter.  I also understand how some people felt mislead by the title and previews - but that's what studios do nowadays with most movies, they feed you the best parts through the previews and leave you wanting during the actual movie - marketing at it's best.  As it turns out, the title doesn't just apply to our little red-headed heroine, but her mother as well - it does, however, over-sell what the movie is really about.  All that being said, it's a very Disney movie, but it was enjoyable and reflective.

Prior to renting the movie ($1.99 special), I read the reviews to ensure its appropriateness for my 7 year old son.  I was also interested in it because a friend had mentioned it touches nicely upon the relationship between a spunky teenager and proper mother - a circumstance in my household.

I must admit the majority of the reviews are spot on and well written.  The movie is heart warming, delivers a good message, and is very entertaining.  My whole family enjoyed it.

Now, to those who say it was too violent, showed too much skin, and had witchcraft in it, well, too each his own, it didn't bother my 7 year old one bit.  Some folks took their toddlers and pre-K aged children to this movie.  All I can say is, "What were you thinking?".  The movie has a PG rating, not G, so responsible and informed parents shouldn't take pre-K kids, in my opinion, as a general rule.

In closing, a good and enjoyable movie with a heart warming theme, especially for proper mothers with spirited daughters - but leave the toddlers at home unless the rough and tumble Saturday morning cartoons don't bother them.

This movie is on the level of most animated movies these days, but no where near the level you would expect from Disney, slow moving plot.
Our heroine is so enduring, I kept wanting to hand her a hair brush and tell her that she would make any mother proud.
Awesome story line, awesome movie.  Would definitely see it over and over. One of my all time favorite Disney movies.
Not nearly up to the standard of other recent animated features. Very thin story line and reliance on  repetitive gags.
Such a sweet move. Great for mothers and daughters. I would watch again and again! Plan on buying in the future for my grandaughter.
My daughter and her friends in college rented this they loved it!!!! They wanted to go back to their childhood.and watch Disney movies

I've seen the negative reviews on this animation and they're right concerning the brief nudity, however it doesn't diminish this film.  The storyline is well done and along the lines of a Pixar animation.  I'm a male without a daughter but would highly recommend this to any mother with a strong willed daughter.  It is very well scripted showing the relationship between a demanding mother and a rebellious daughter and the outcome left me in tears...everytime I watched it.  The colors are beautiful and the storyline is definitely keeping with a Pixar animation.  Frankly it's very funny and I enjoyed this every time I watched it.  The scary theme might not be adequate for very young children but the nudity is mild and not excessive.  Very satisfied with the way Pixar developed the storyline.  Don't be too uptight to enjoy the overall theme or you might just miss it.

Well visually, musically, acting, etc, it is all up to disney pixar standards, except where the plot line goes. It's the same typical plot line I have seen in a million movies, and not even remotely hid or spun into a new concept. Kinda disappointing, but pretty.
I thought it was gorgeous, funny and different from the usual "princess" movies. It surprised me and I loved all the characters.

Oh I love this one-- I love this princess-- I just love her!!! Finally a princess with a ruddy complexion and flaming red hair that problem solves and doesn't need a man to take care of her problems!  Love it.  Just love it.
I would recommend this movie to kids. It had a positive message. My nine year old daughter liked it a lot!!
Great movie and what made it even better was being able to download it from the comfort of my own home!!
Saw this movie in theatre and enjoy watching it at home with the grandkids. Great inspirational movie, especially for girls.
My kids, my husband and I loved this movie it was such a good movie!!! It was cute and adventurous!

3 STARS IS MY OPINION OF MOVIE.
IT WAS SLIGHTLY DISAPPOINTING DUT TO THE ACCENT.
SCOTTISH ACCENT WAS VERY HARD TO UNDERSTAND AT TIMES.

I'd wanted to see "Brave" since seeing the first trailer, but time and circumstance forced me to wait until I could stream it.  Overall it wasn't quite what I'd hoped; a good story with many funny/touching moments but a relatively thin plot, that focuses more on the bond between mother and daughter than on anything as epic as the trailer led me to believe.  Merida is a likable enough heroine, and the supporting cast are all well played, and the three little brothers are adorable in their otherwise silent mischief.  So while not a great film like past efforts such as "Shrek" or "Ratatouille" it's still quite enjoyable, and most definitely a good family film.
Awesome story and animation. I really loved the Scottish scenery and characters- very authentic. Love the strong female protagonist! Great for all ages.
I really enjoyed this movie. As a Disney/Pixar, it was very well put together. Brave is a tale of magic and parenting, understanding and change.

We watched this together with our 5 yr. Old daughter. It was a cute movie and I enjoyed it
It too but some of the scenes were a little intense for her.
My family and I love this movie.  While I love the fairy tale  stories, what I love most about Brave is that Merida does not need a prince to save her.  She saves her family herself.
So boooooooring that my daughter, 6 years old ended up sleeping the first 25 min I two attempts to see the movie!

Great movie. For kids or adults.
Has a good story line, and overall message.
Awesome graphics with attention to detail.
It was a good movie but not  as good as Dragon Tale. Definitely not the kind of movie you'd want to watch again and again.
We are in our 70s and enjoyed the movie, very entertaining, it's a good movie for all ages to watch.
Wonderful animation and acting. While a great cartoon experience, it was also a touching movie about growth.  Loved it.  I would see it again.
I enjoyed this tremendously. The characters, storyline and setting were exquisite. There was actually a really scary bear! I didn't expect the bad guy to be so bad:) Great family film

Good movie for all ages, will tug at your heart strings.
Lots of action and adventure. A good story with a wonderful ending.
It was a super cute movie.  I watched it with my husband at two little girls (5 & 3 yrs), and we all loved it.
I really liked this movie. Good for all ages! Great for family nights in. I would buy it if i could!
this is a great movie again by pixar! good mix of comedy, drama, and action. The plot is great not many weaknesses I would suggest this movie.
Fun movie -- may be frightening for some kids who haven't yet distinguished between story and fact, but that's Disney for you.

I have a Samsung BD-C8000, and it won't play the 3d.  It will load the Blu-Ray disk to the point of the title bar, then it stops.  Samsung (in India) says "so sorry, gotta wait for the next update, you can't play this"  Samsung hasn't updated this player since 2011, so I'm not holding my breath.  So, if 3d is important to you, beware, Disney likes to use "new" encryption schemes, and your Blu-Ray player might not play this title!  Thanks Disney and Samsung for making me pay a bundle of $$ for a coaster.  I do like the movie...I don't like paying for disks I can't watch.

If anyone HAS watched the 3d portion successfully, please respond to this and tell me what worked for you!  Specifically, which BD player can play it?

As typical with Pixar, this movie is a strong, original outing.

A young warrior princess, Merida, rebels against her family's attempts to arrange a marriage for her.  She journeys into the woods and finds a witch, who allows Merida to cast a spell on her mother (turning her into a giant bear).  Through adventures, and her father attempting to hunt the bear, both Merida and her family realize that allowing each to find their own destiny is best.

The visuals, and particularly the scenery and background, are lush and gorgeous.  Pixar continues to push the boundaries of animation and the movie is a treat to watch.  They continue to improve the animation of the animals and the people. And as usual for Pixar, the story is fresh and original, though in this case it feels like a traditional Scottish fairy tale.

Highly recommended for families or fans of animation.

The start of the film may seem like something promising, maybe like a 'How to Train your Dragon' theme. However, the movie quickly turns into a road that has been all too well-traveled. How many movies can you name where the main character doesn't like the situation they are in, turns to witches and magic, doesn't get what they bargain for and the rest of the movie is based on fixing that problem?

Answer: too many

Obviously, that's where I think the movie lacks originality. Tired of the same ol' thing from Disney. Hoping whoever is left from the original Pixar crew will stand up to what's helped them become such a success story and go back to those unique and fresh elements.

Just an honest opinion, but another movie with this same plot and Pixar will RIP in my book.

Despite the quality animation, I could not identify with the decision of the main character to put her strict but caring mother in danger merely to satisfy her selfish ends.  We were reminded of a standard Disney theme: headstrong young female defies parental authority and although her life is threatened and many other lives are put at risk, ultimately everyone has 'learned' from this selfish person and she is gloriously rewarded for her defiance.

Yes she was unaware of the risks she was taking, but that's the definition of selfishness - not taking any time to consider the consequences your actions might have on others.
`
Tasty but deadly poison for 8-14 year old girls IMHO.  My children will not be watching this film.
Strong women, and men, and no sappy un-realistic love story to muck it up! I want a cauldron answering system. Gingers rule!

Instead of paying to rent this movie, I decided to just buy it.  Having buyer's remorse.  I LOVED Tangled, which is one reason I bought Brave without renting it first.  Brave was ok but I just didn't fall in love with it like I did with Tangled.  I'm not sure why, it was just boring.  Worth the price of a rental, not buying the DVD.

the movie starts off with a major serious tone. a family movie with serious tones.
but later it makes a move for the slightly better atleast for the more funny..reminding me of the old
Disney film ... Brother Bear.. it's definatly not Pixar's best effort but it's better than a lot of other crap out
there by other studios live action or animated... but be aware there are some butt shots. kids might find it
funny. adults found it shocking...

Its an okay movie but has to much Disney influence in the production.  The story is just so-so and the character  development wasn't great. If it was made just by Disney it would have been fine.  But this being a Pixar production they really drop the ball.

I'm sure this was much better in the theaters and in 3D. The animation was pretty nice and the visuals were probably pretty amazing in the theater. It's just that the story was kind of dumb. I like the idea of a girl who wants to change her destiny from one of being married off to one in which she has a say and think it's empowering for young girls. However, her mom gets turned into a bear? We were sitting there going, who came up with this idea?
LOVE THIS!!!! My Daughter will be so excited for CHRISTMAS!!!! I have not seen this movie myself and pretty excited to see it!!!!!!

I do not know why this story has gotten so many bad reviews.  For one, I have to say the scary scenes are not so scary.  Both of my girls must just be Brave and Strong young girls, because both of them don't seem to be bothered by the movie.  Now we did purchase the book a while ago and have read the story to them a number of times and discussed the scary scenes.  We also sat down as a family, made popcorn and watched it all together with our 6yr old and almost 4yr old.  I have to say there are some parts that I was not a fan of--for instance how she visits a witch to change her mother and that the food was left around for her brothers to eat.  But the hype about the nudity and every thing else...what are we puritans.  My girls didn't even seem to notice that the boys were naked.  I thought I was a wonderful story about how some traditions should be changed and left behind!!!! Like marrying your daughters off at a young age, making them wear outdated clothing and arranging their marriages.

Hence the break from tradition, which all the young men were happy about as well.  It was refreshing to have a movie that showed how a girl could be strong and not have to "live happily ever after" and marry prince charming. Or be saved by a man.  It showed how she must figure out how to make things right through problem-solving. My husband and I believe our two daughters need to learn to rely on themselves and someday, as I did, find a wonderful man to share their lives.  We do not believe that our girls need a man to be complete--nor should a man need a woman--they should be healthy independent persons who are not co-dependent.

I thought it was a delightful show that let you see how both mother and daughter were not listening to one another and after mom gets changed into a bear, they spend time mending and bonding together.  I have to say, parents sometimes get very hung up in having to have things their way and do not listen to their children.  I am also guilty at times--no one is perfect.  I liked how the bonds were mended both concretely for young children (with the tapestry), verbally and physically for older children and parents.  Both the mother and Merida matured while working together to mend their relationship and change mom back into a human.
This movie is a great twist on the typical princess movies out there. Best part is the diversity now a days.

This movie was a bit darker then expected, but still good. My 5 year old twins had mixed reaction. My son enjoyed it, but my daughter seemed more disturbed by it. Of course she loves all the sweet gentle Disney Princess and this fiesty spirited Pixar princess was not what she expected, plus the bear scenes were a bit on the loud side. The second time she watched it, I actually heard her laugh at a few scenes and found it less shocking so she enjoyed it more.

Loved the movie and the animation is fantastic - my issues have been with the 3D disc. I have returned and received four replacements all with the same results. I am using this on my internal Lite-On BD Drive with Cyberlink PowerDVD 12 Ultra with latest firmware/software updates and I can play all of my BluRay Movies in 3D with my Asus/NVidia monitor and 3D glasses except this one's 3D disc which in all four attempts I have received from Amazon the 3D disc itself has visible distortion whereas the 2D version in the same packages plays fine and does not have any visible distortion. The 3D discs will all play part way through but will then seize with tearing in the video and will lock up the Cyberlink Software.

This is such a pleasant surprise. My husband and I decided to check it out, even though we have no children, and were both moved by the story and the art. This is a beautiful piece of work Highly recommended.

For me this movie was a prime example of misleading previews!!  I went into this movie thinking I was going to see the story of a princess who fights to keep her freedom...and to be honest I kind of got that for the first 20 minutes of the movie.  She quickly looses the battle has a tantrum and runs away, gets a potion from a witch and turns her mom and 3 siblings into bears.  Then realizes that maybe she shouldn't have done that and tries to get an antidote before her father kills said bears.  I found the story to be very boring and in general badly written.  I didn't care about any of the characters, which surprises me so much as this came from Pixar and they ALWAYS get me to care about the characters.  The animation was stunning that's why it gets 2 stars.

I went into this film realizing it was rather polarizing and tried to have an open mind. The animation quality was top notch but the story was not very well done and the main character was  unlikeable, whiny, immature and ungrateful.

I love most Pixar films and I've enjoyed watching many of them over and over but I have no desire to ever see this again. I'm glad I didn't buy it.
Not pixar's best, but a very pretty film with an enjoyable story. Looks great on blu ray and the special features are very fun to watch.

As all Pixar films, BRAVE is beautiful to look at!  The story could have been ... I dunno ... richer? It has kind of a Brother Bear-meets-Little-Mermaid going on. Girl defies parents, makes a mess, etc... I wanted to love it, but it was a tad boring.

The "nudity" people complained about is laughable -- surely everyone knows about Scotland & kilts. A few butts is hardly any worse than Shrek (not Disney, I realize) saying, "I've got to save me a$$!".

BRAVE is okay, but not destined to be my favorite.

Brave is a great movie. It provides a great story line about how our choices may impact others and how we need to take responsibility for our choices and our lives...all that and some good laughs along the way. What I am not laughing about is finding out AFTER the fact that Amazon Instant Video will not deliver this..or other movies... in HD to my HTPC. Don't know whether this is a licensing issue or a marketing tool to get me to buy a Roku or other "supported device". Amazon should prominently inform you of this limitation before you make your purchase. Better yet, allow me to order instant videos in HD for watching on my PC. Crazy...a $400 HTPC with no HD but I need a $50 black box to get HD...come on Amazon!

And, while watching the film, all I could think of was this film is a horrible collision of Braveheart, Poltergeist and Brother Bear. My kids ranging from 12 to 2 sadly also agreed :(

Father do not listen to mom, mom don't listen to daughter, daughter don't listen to mom and so on. Even the guests do not listen to the host and quarrel all the time. There is no bravery (it does not connect with the story), no suspense, and no story. I can't believe someone in pixar approved this two step storyline. Marvel atleast write some story for their characters.

Brave I was looking for a movie that would take me away from the real world for a couple of hours. I found everything I was wanting in the DVD Brave. I felt relaxed after the movie and loved the story. I have been off Disney movies for several years but Brave has make a great impression.

This movie almost describes me to a T. I can relate with everything she goes through. Like the others have said, this is a great movie for mothers and daughters. I can feel this movie deep in my soul as if I were Merida.
See we DO NOT need a man to survive, but if you want one then go for it. I am happy by myself. Like Merida...
I saw nothing wrong with this movie, scary, nudity (It was their butts. Get over it. Nobody complains when the women show their breasts.) or otherwise. If you think there is you have something wrong with you.

I found this animated film from PIXAR to be delightfully entertaining. I would not have any reservations letting my children see this movie inspite of it's modern profeminist point of view depicted in the movie. Our young heroine shows courage and strength as well as beauty and charm and her message voiced by, I think, women everywhere. The film is fun to watch and very entertaining and I would buy it again.
Good for girls and boys alike. Movie helps bridge the generations. A great movie... almost wish I had three little brothers who turn into bears! LOL

Received the DVD set, opened it up and put in the Blue Ray DVD, and....  the Castle.  That's it.  Sleeping Beauty's castle from the park when they have the opening Walt Disney credits thing.  Water was flowing beneath, and the flag was moving on top, but that was it.  Couldn't stop it.  Couldn't pause it.  Couldn't move forward/back, skip, change view.  When pressing play button, 51 minutes appeared at the top for the length of the castle doing nothing.  Menu didn't work.  Root menu didn't work.  Don't get me wrong, was a beautiful picture of the castle.  But no way to see a movie.  Swapped out the Blu Ray Bonus disc.  Same thing.  Put in 3D disc.  Same thing.  Put in regular DVD, and there we have what is supposed to happen.  Haven't tried the digital disc yet.
Would have expected all the discs to work on this.  Hopefully a one off, and will revamp this rating if it gets fixed.

Arrived Tuesday, 11/13/12, via pre-ordered - Wonderful, sealed, new, all versions included - So glad to have it - Thank You!  THIS IS A GREAT, Great Movie!  Story - What incredible Animation Detail - Fascinating!  A Must Have!
Disney and Pixar are at their best!  Very moving, beautiful, funny, tender, emotional, movie! Top notch animation and love the soundtrack!
I loved this movie and I'm 26. One can never be too old for cartoons and animated movies, in fact I think they're awesome.

I really enjoyed watching this movie, but I am surprised that more people did not comment that it is really not for small children. I'd recommend it for ages 8 and up--minimum! But I guess that a world that lets 6-yr-old watch Batman would find this tame. The animation is gorgeous and the story original.

I was very frustrated to find that the 3D disc would freeze during play.  I removed the disc and checked the back for any scratches or prints.  There weren't any.  I cleaned my player and popped it in.  It happened again in different parts of the movie 26 to 30 minutes in. I had to play the regular BluRay disc, which played fine. I was really annoyed because I bought it for the 3D experience.  I believe the 3D disc was defective.  Did anyone else experience this?

Watched this with my 5 yr old neice. Some of it was a little scary for her, there is a bear that's a little frightening at the begining and the end of the movie. Other than that it was a very cute movie. Teaches a lesson about daughter/mother relationship.

Impressive at Brave was on the big screen, there's something intensely dazzling to see it in Blu-ray. The almost infinite details fill every millimeter of the home screen.

Brave is a sweeping epic tale, but it's also an intimate examination of mother/daughter relationship. Although I enjoyed the film and saw it twice in theaters, as a dad and husband, I found the scene in which Merida gives her mother something to ingest that could be extremely harmful or fateful, is kind of difficult to take. Merida then snaps into denial of wrongdoing, which pushes more than a few buttons.

But I'm not a Mom or a daughter. When I saw the film with two sets of each, they resoundingly loved the film with absolutely no reservations. Being mothers of teen daughters, they each agreed that of course, the girl would be driven to risk anything to make her mother change, not considering the consequences and, yes, not owning up to it.

How Merida does face the impact of her actions, the fate of the kingdom, and her parental issues, is the heart of Brave, and what you must experience from beginning to end. Few films, animated or not, take a character through such a character arc in such a plausible, believable way. The Brady Bunch this ain't.

The magnificent score by Patrick Doyle is as epic as the film, and the voice cast is ideal. Pains were taken to make things as authentic as possible, as evidenced by the bonus features.

And what a feast of bonus features there are, at least on the Blu-ray. The DVD does contain the audio commentary (thank you!) and two short films, but depending on which Blu-ray set you choose, you get a lot of cool stuff.

Basically the 3-disc "Ultimate Collector's Edition" includes everything that the 5-disc Disney/Pixar's Brave: The Ultimate Collector's Edition does except for a Blu-ray 3-D disc and a digital download disc.

Here's are the bonus features:

DISC ONE / FEATURE FILM

 * Audio Commentary

 * Short Films
  1. La Luna
  2. The Legend of Mordu

 * Behind the Scenes
  1. Brave Old World
  2. Merida & Elinor
  3. Bears
  4. Brawl in the Hall
  5. Wonder Moss
  6. Magic
  7. Clan Pixar
  8. Once Upon a Scene

 * Extended Scenes
  1. Meet the Lords
  2. Triplets Distraction
  3. The Ruins
  4. Blockade

DISC TWO / BONUS FEATURES

  * Fergus & Mordu - An Alternate Opening

  * Fallen Warriors (short deleted shots)

  * Dirty Hairy People

  * It is English...Sort of (Doric dialect)

  * Angus (the horse)

  * The Tapestry

* Promotional Pieces
  1. Feast Yer Eyes! Wee Bits of Animation (montage of
  comical blackouts)
  2. Relics: A Lyre, Cauldron and a Rock
  3. Clan Dun Broch (Fergus Offers a Lesson)
  4. Launch (Merida Teaches the Triplets Archery)
  5. Flying Guts Theater (Presenting An Entertainment)
  6. USA/Japan/UK Trailers

* Art Gallery
  1. Characters
  2. Color Keys
  3. Development Art
  4. Environments
  5. Graphics

A warm, cozy fairy tale that feels more like a Disney production than the latest entry in Pixar's storybook. It's sweet, quirky and funny, but routinely falls back on familiar motifs and often seems criminally under-explored. Since the vast majority of the action takes place in and around a single locale, there's a claustrophobic quality in the air that never truly dissipates, which robs us of the grand scale that's been present in every one of the animation factory's preceding works. It's no more than a straightforward telling of a reasonably interesting fable, with only a few short jolts of the unique character and timely laughs I've come to expect from the troupe. Of course, there's no arguing the fact that Pixar knows how to produce gorgeous scenery, and Brave is yet another leap forward in that regard; the surrounding landscapes are unanimously breathtaking, and Princess Merida's hair is constantly bouncy and lifelike, truly a character unto itself. It's an enjoyable fresh ride and a marked improvement over the lifeless Cars 2, but misses the depth and flair that made me fall so deeply in love with the studio's classics.

We saw this in the theatre and absolutely loved it! It was a movie both my son and daughter enjoyed. Lots of great humor and action. All of the characters were wonderfully created! I highly recommend it for your movie library. : )

I wish I could say I got to see most of it, or even half of it.  For me, it is a pet peeve, when movies are made to be seen in total darkness (i.e.. in a theater.)  Such movies do not translate well in a home environment ..... unless watched without any lights on, and with black-out curtains.

I do not always sit, inactive, on a couch to watch TV.  I like to watch movies while working on crafts, or other activities in my home office.  Turning off all the lights sort of inhibits my ability to multi-task in this way.

I've grown to expect bad lighting in live action movies, but with animation........?  That's just poor crafting on the part of the artists and producers.

Wise up, people (movie creators)!  If you intend to rake in extra revenue in after-theater sales of DVD's and Blue-Ray, at least make them viewable.  I turned off every light in my room, so I wouldn't be watching the bookcase reflection from behind me, and craft light on my desk; and I STILL ended up just listening to the dialogue while staring at my own face reflected from my monitor (Amazon Instant Video.)  I certainly don't want to pay to see a movie, and get the dubious pleasure of watching my annoyed self squinting/straining to see what was happening, on screen.

Mine is a review of the 'product', not the story or acting (voices.)  In the review instructions, Amazon states, "Reviews must contain at least 20 words about the PRODUCT."  Don't get me wrong, I thought the story was very sweet, and had an enlightened, but not illuminated, message (earning my 4 stars.) To be fair, I did not want to bring down the average for the overall rating, just because I was not watching in an ideal setting.

Great deal here. For 20.00, I got a Blu-Ray, DVD and a bonus movie. Great movie too. I purchased it sight-unseen because I love Pixar's work but also it's just great reference (I'm a 3D artist too). The hair and water sims in this movie are mind-boggling. Great story too, of course. I totally recognized Kelly MacDonald's voice from Boardwalk Empire.

There was not a particular aspect of the movie that was particularly disappointing. It was just weak all around. The animation was good, but the storyline and character development was shallow and predictable. It was like watching a high quality Saturday morning cartoon episode. Plus the message for children was not exactly exemplary: while your defiant spirit gets you in trouble, it can also get you out of it. Hmmm... dunno about that.

I was reading the negative reviews & was surprised to see people saying this is a scary movie with no story line... I loved this movie for the fact that it shows my 3 year old she doesn't need to be a perfect girl to be a princess. I absolutely loved the rough around the edges approach Disney & Pixar took with this. I'm by no means a violent person, but the "violence" that was depicted in the film was kid-friendly enough. My 3 year old hasn't shown any interest in becoming a killer of bears or anything unusual. To note- we live by a plant-based diet & definitely don't recommend the unnecessary killing of animals. I also liked that there was a real relationship depicted between Merida & her mother. It's not always an agreeable & happy time in real families & this showed how, while much more magical, there are always issues between family members because they are different personalities. I also appreciated that she was in the stable taking care of her horse showing that, while she's a princess, she still has responsibilities to tend to. I highly recommend this movie:)
This is another well done animated movie - great color!  I thoroughly enjoyed it, but it may be a bit too intense (scary) in places for the little ones.
I so enjoyed this movie with my granddaughter. i would suggest it to all and any. it is a funny enjoyable movie.
the girls saw it at the theatre and we all watched it again on Amazon, loved the movie and loved the content and story within a story

It a typically Disney Movie. I give it five star but is a four or four and a half stars movie. You be the judge after you see it. I think is a good movie to have in your Disney collection.. 3D is very good.
This movie came out at the perfect time for me. My kids are 6 and this movie showed them how to mend what pride has broken. Awesome movie my number 1 disney movie.

There aren't many kids movies today the whole family can sit down and watch without Mom and Dad (or Grandparents etc)wanting to shoot themselves.  For example, I can't watch Barbie movies with my daughter, I hate them.  I also can't watch most cartoons with her.  They just aren't interesting.  BUT, not only did I love this movie, my husband (and even tougher critic) also loved this movie.  My daughter got this movie as a surprise this week, not because she wanted it (though she did, she asked for it every time she saw a picture of Merida anywhere) but because my husband and I wanted it for ourselves LOL!!!  It's seriously a great movie, funny, and touching with a good lesson, and a little action in there too.  Just a really great movie all around.

After reading a few other reviews, I thought I should add that if you are offended by animated butts, or bears eating "live" fish, this movie is not for you.  Also, if you expect a children's movie to be the movie of a century with sub plots and rhetoric fit to engender hour long conversations, this probably isn't for you either.  It's a feel good movie, perfect for a family with members of all ages, and a nice break from the Prince saving the Princess fairy tales we are used to.
This is the first movie I have  ever seen with CLOSED CAPTIONS on amazon instant video. Keep up the good work amazon. Bravo!

I am of mixed opinion on this movie, and so were my kids (ages 8 and 6.) I love that it features a girl heroine, and I love the moody, beautiful Scottish setting and corresponding animation (5 stars for that.) But I was disappointed in the story, and felt some of the magic fell flat (3 stars on that, for a 4 overall.) The accents were also a bit difficult for my kids to follow at times, and there wasn't the warmth and humor in this that the best Pixar films have. There were flashes of it, but it wasn't consistent. I also found myself doing  a lot of explaining, partly because of the accent issues, and partly because some of the plot lines were a little over my kids' heads. I have read that this movie changed hands internally at Pixar several times, and it feels that way - a little disjointed and unsure of its identity. It doesn't have that 'vision' quality that their best films do. But it is gorgeous, and Merida is a lovely and fun character.

I thought this movie was pretty bad, and I signed on to Amazon to tell people this because the trailer you see for this movie is completely misleading.  (Spoiler alert): It is not about a young girl who is courageous and fights for something realistic or anything like that, its simply about a girl who follows magic lights in the forest to a witches house and subsequently has her mother turned into a bear, and she spends the rest of the movie trying to turn her back into a human.  I am a big fan of pixar films, but this one, this one is just stupid.  And let me note, I expected a lot from this movie too, so that may play in to my 1 star review, the trailer looked really good, but its nothing like what the trailer portrays.

While not one of Pixar's finest films (Up, WALL-E, Toy Story), Brave is a hilarious, rousing, visually stunning, well-acted, beautifully crafted, excellent film for the whole family!
Four Brilliant Stars!
Really enjoyed the story the movie was visually very dark even after messing with the tv settings but overall very entertaining movie for young children the bears can be a bit scary I would think.

Be careful what you wish for...Brave is a very neat story with moral lessons. To be strong, a family needs to stand by each other. It was a nice way to show the kids about the importance of families by watching Brave altogether.
We really enjoyed this movie the whole family got into it love the storyline the music the characters the whole thing
The kid in me loved the break in traditional princesses and the adult in me liked that there's a lesson or 3 to be learn no matter the age.

Same old same old story. Lacking all novelty. Lame parents. Poor misunderstood princess who is just so special....but sadly misunderstood. Lots of predictable stuff happens and then the story ends. Of course the princess finds her true voice and the parents realize how wrong they were.
It nice to finally have a princess who is not your typical princess. My girls (5 & 3) both have bows. They just love the fact that Merida is like them. A princess they can relate to.

This movie is action packed all the way through!  It's fun for everyone, with some educational elements, and lots of beautiful scenery. Great vivid color and (A+) level CG Animation. Great hard hitting action, and sound effects on Blue Ray! It's a great unique storyline. There are NO dry areas in this movie. It's put together very well. Buy it on Blue Ray. Thank you.

The biggest beef I have with "Brave" is the title and how it relates to character development. When, exactly, was Merida brave? She was foolish and got herself into trouble, and then panicked about how to fix it. I had expected more heroism on her part. Something equivalent to selflessly running into a burning building. It just never happened. She ended up crying and - ta da! - wouldn't you know it, that... somehow... solved it. Huh. I just don't buy into the "strong female lead" thing with Merida.

This movie was not what I expected at all. The main "twist" in the plot took it down 10 notches from "Oh, this could be really interesting!" to "...oh, I really am watching a kid's movie, aren't I." Another case of a misleading trailer sucking me in.

For basic entertainment, it's OK. But, I strongly believe it was over hyped and mis-marketed just to get our ticket money. I left the theater feeling unsatisfied.

All in all, I think the movie tried to do too much at once, lost its focus, and ought to have returned to the drawing board.

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie both for content and characters. It is not the typical princess movie from Disney and I liked that! Breaking out of the mold, this movie has heart and shows that happy endings don't have to include a prince every time. Sometimes, that happy ending comes in the form of your family. Sometimes that happy ending is found in your own heart. Loved it and recommend it for everyone.

One of Pixar's best! I love everything about this movie, especially since the characters are ancient Celts and that era has to be my favorite time period. Maybe I'm partial to the landscape and time but there is something about the charm of the characters and the breathtaking shots that make this movie a must have for anyone, even if they don't have kids!

This production is so brilliant in conception and execution that it seems almost petty to quibble with any aspect of it. But the problem with any work of art that's nearly but not quite perfect is that the imperfection stands in relief.

There is a definite disconnection between the words mouthed by the human actors and the mouth movements of the animated figures. At times it's almost as if sound is not quite synchronized to picture, but with this Blu-Ray recording, the synchronization is of course exact. Or, it's as if (almost) the picture has been dubbed into a foreign language. This is especially true where the faces, like that of the heroine, are greatly simplified, rounded, smoothed and stylized. With grotesque faces, such as that of the witch, where extreme facial distortions are employed by the animators, the lip-syncing is perfectly convincing. A fuller range of facial muscles appear to be forming the words, and the result is presented as far more convincingly human.

It's a small quibble indeed. I had not seen any animated film in years; they just never drew me in. They all were so childish, and none captured my attention. This one draws me in completely, and as someone who is sixty-eight, my tastes have become jaded.

See this one in Blu-Ray. It really is worth all of twenty-five bucks.

One reason we have never let our kids watch The Little Mermaid (Two-Disc Platinum Edition), is because of how disrespectful Ariel is. The whole story is based on her disobedience and disrespect for her father. Not to mention Disney isn't known for having strong, good mother figures (most mothers are evil or non-existent).

So as we are sitting watching Brave, my wife keeps looking at me with that look of, "There is no way our kids are going to watch this movie and not think its okay to disrespect your folks. In addition, it will probably happen in the end that the disrespect will get overlooked in light of some greater threat."

But we stuck through it and have to say we really, really liked the story in the end.

The animation was top-notch for sure, no questions Pixar would do anything less than excellent.

The humor is throughout and entertaining.

The movie finished about twenty minutes ago and there is no blood in the movie. . .from what I can remember.

The violence against others is in Three Stooges humor, defending one's self, or chasing something evil.

SPOILER:

Even when the heroine realizes a witch is involved, she doesn't hesitate to ask the witch for help. Doesn't this communicate that it's okay to seek power from "evil" sources is okay? The characters even make fun early on that the dad doesn't believe in magic and how silly he is for such things. I could just imagine some teens standing up in the theaters shouting, "Wiccas Unite!!"

OVERALL: A good story that has more potential and is set up for a sequel.
It's worth the watch and the 3-disc Blu Ray / DVD set is less than $10 this coming Black Friday sale at Walmart or Best Buy. . .not sure about Amazon's sales price yet.
I watched this movie with my 7 year old daughter who loved it.  I aslo liked the movie.  I don't think I would get it for just me but it is totaly watchable with your kids.

First I'll start off by saying, WOW, the colors and scenes in this movie are breath-taking and I love the accents (though people behind me were complaining about not catching what was being said). I love Merida's fiery red hair and her independent spirit. I love her oafish father and her prim mother.

That being said, I thought this movie had elements in it that go right over anyone eight and under's head. Choosing between suitors for the good of the country? Do young kids even know what a suitor is? Or why alliances between countries were formed often times though marriage?

This movie is also dark, scary and violent at times, with a freaky witch and some very intense bear scenes. My five year old flew off her chair and landed in my lap. My seven year old was closing her eyes and covering her ears.

Those scenes aside, there is much humor in this movie and I found myself laughing as loud as the kids, and there is also touching, sentimental scenes where a tear or two might appear.

This is a movie where parents will have to be the judge. A tender child might be traumatized after watching this, while a "tougher" child will find it all very exciting.

A good movie, but a bit violent and dark.

All in all, I wasn't really enthralled with this movie one way or the other: hence the down the middle rating.  The animation was good, but to some degree, these movies are starting to get a little out there for kids.

The witch for example, is not the "friendliest" character in the movie.  While Pixar tries to make a witch not scary and frightening, I believe she still comes across as such.  The bears attacking each other and the cursed bear can provide a few scary moments.

By the end of the movie, I was tired of the overdone accents of the characters.  It was cute at first, but 93 minutes of hard to understand scottish accents was a little too much for me.

Glad we rented it and didn't buy it.

I have to start off by saying how great it was for the women to be the focus of a story!

We (my husband and I) noticed first thing that the male characters were really secondary to the central theme, and loved it!  So many Disney stories, and fairy tales in general, have women as the main character, but they still seem to revolve around the men in the story.  It was refreshing to see a movie told entirely from the point of view of women who weren't consumed by love, devotion, or duty to some male in their life (alive or dead), or some ideal set forth by said male.  Ultimately, these women were focused on long-held feminine ideals: freedom, peace, and the preservation of family (or clan).

Finally a story told of the influence that women exert through intelligence, grace, dignity, and determination!  This movie made sure you saw the men hurrying to punch each other out , while the women made the biggest impact simply by crossing a room with dignity or by being eloquent.  Our history books often overlook the strength and influence that women have had throughout the ages, not by being warriors, but through sacrifice and diplomacy.  This movie reminds us that women have their own abilities, equal to and different from those of men, but just as amazing.

This movie was literally overflowing with female influence: yes, some of it with cleavage, but most of it with long sought and hard-won skill, patience, and determination.  A valuable lesson for our future women!

I was very surprised at the way this movie was beautifully created and written. It was not at all like the previews suggested, but still a pleasant film from Disney and Pixar. The attention to detail was spectacular and the way the water rushed down the river and off the stone of the castle wasn't something I had been fully prepared for, much less the detailing of the bear's fur and own maiden's curly locks! The plot of the movie was an interesting moral tale that I'll let you watch to find out for yourself how wonderfully written it is! Overall a well thought-out, gorgeously animated film to be watched over and over!
Brave is cute.  The story isn't new but pixar puts its own swing on it.  The 3D version translates well to big screen home TV.

This is one movie to add to your collection of entertainment.  The plot, the animation, the effects, the color, and the folks at Pixar has done it again.  When you see anything with Pixar on the label, grab it.  Disney was smart enough for once to see the writing on the wall.  These folks have such a grasp on what the world wants to see.  It is one of the best all time greats.  It will match anything Disney has out there.  I watched it four times in one day.  IT IS THAT GOOD!

After the 2011 Pixar misfire with "Cars 2" I had expected for Brave to be much better.

Only better by a little  Not anywhere near Pixar's USED TO BE great story telling, characters, etc.

You follow the story then you go into this weird story line that true you did NOT see coming BUT just went south from there.

No spoiler alerts although I will say it had to do with Oscar winner Emma Thompson's Queen Elinor.

For a 5 disc set, this SHOULD HAVE BEEN MUCH BETTER.  I always look for extras like "Making Of" on Disney/Pixar films.  NONE here, there are plenty of extras but none of real interest to me.

They made a new Disney Princess that just stands out because of her appearance, the red hair.  If you want to go to a GOOD liberated Disney Princess look at 1992's "Aladdin" for Princess Jasmine.

It is a good film but NOT up to usual Pixar stands.  If you want extras on your blu rays you got them but for me just not the type I want.
Really Disney/Pixar?????  You think our children need to see the naked butts of animated grown men???  Please don't do that anymore.

I thought this movie was fantastic.  As good a picture as any Pixar film.  The animation is very special and in 3D it is wow.
I loved this movie. It was thoughtful and full of action and funny and scary and wise.  It had everything. Plus it was a real
original. I just loved it and thought it was everything I would want in an animated film. It had guts and it had heart.

I've been trying to understand why some seem to be lukewarm about BRAVE.  Some would like to see the beginning cut so that the action starts sooner, I would say that you'd miss the exposition if it wasn't there.  I, for one, enjoyed every minute of it.  Some have said that the backgrounds were too realistic, I think the backgrounds (and all the animation) is just incredibly beautiful.  I would agree with the sentiment that it would have been nice to see more of the mother/daughter interaction, but then the movie would have been too long for the younger kids.  It's there appropriately, but when the mother and daughter's relationship changes it could have been a slower process and I'd have enjoyed it because I'm at an age where I can enjoy the subtle changes.  A ten-year-old wouldn't like that so I can understand the choice.  I've read all the negative reviews, but I just don't agree.  BRAVE is a great film.

As for this 5-Disc Ultimate Collector's Edition - It's fine.  I would have liked a sound remix for the 2 channel Dolby.  The dialogue is slightly too weak or the musical soundtrack too loud.  But if you aren't listening to the film on internal TV speakers then you're fine.  It's all great and nothing too terribly distracting.  It's great that Disney included so many extras.  That makes buying these versions worth the extra $$.  I couldn't care less about the 3D, but it's there if I care to watch it.  But I honestly never do.
Just watch the movie. It is really,  really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, really, fabulous darling.

Brave did not surprise me, good or bad. The animated movie was cute but not deep enough to warrant admiration. The animation was good, but not great. It was ok for my wife and I to spend a couple hours of light entertainment. Good movie for elementary school age children.

I like all kinds of  movies and had  high expectations  on this one but, it fell short to me mainly  because the story should of been better.
In some ways too simple and other ways didn't go anywhere; the story went places that it should of.
Good movie, which the grandkids really love, and came in at an unbelievable price.  We are very happy with this purchase.

What a charming movie.  It was a funny story with all the usual laugh out loud and sentimental parts that Pixar animated films usually have.  Being a Scot living abroad it was also nice to hear a lot of Scottish accents together (even if some were a bit dubious) and even I laughed heartily at trying to understand the "Aberdonian" accent of Lord MacGuffin's son.  It also made me a little home sick to see the beautiful Scottish scenery reflected in this cartoon - there is nowhere in the world like it.

My only concern about the movie itself would be that a lot of the humour felt very Scottish and I think it would be lost on your average American movie watcher.  The story was nothing special and there were several things that happened that were not explained.  Why a bear, for example?  Perhaps, I am just overthinking it a bit.

I was also disappointed in the 3D effects.  While it gave the scenery some depth it felt as if the movie had just been an old movie made in normal 2D and then converted into 3D.  There was some scenes that could have been made more dramatic by using the 3D effect in a more effective way.

So if you are looking to pass 90 minutes with a charming animated movie, then try it but don't worry about seeing it in 3D.

This movie is amazing! It's beautiful, funny, touching... and a good, fast-paced story that will keep both children and adults, boys and girls entertained. Princess Merida doesn't want to be "just" a Princess-- she wants to carve her own path, her own destiny, and show what she can really DO in this world... and in so doing, she learns not only can a lady be a fighter-- but that a fighter can be a lady... There are bits in there for the entire family, and you're missing out if you don't watch this gem, plus the animation is just beautiful and the story is amazingly original. It's not a one-dimensional damsel story or a two-dimensional girl-power story, either. It's about the power of FAMILY, and LOVE... and it's just adorably raucous and funny. (King Fergus, Queen Helena and the Princes, Hubert, Hamish and Hargus... adorable. Plus, I just love the accents and the music... can't recommend this highly enough.
